quotes.quote: Negative emotions like hatred destroy our peace of mind.
All emotions are pure which gather you and lift you up; that emotion is impure which seizes only one side of your being and so distorts you.
The finest emotion of which we are capable is the mystic emotion.
Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.
Emotions have taught mankind to reason.
It is not our exalted feelings, it is our sentiments that build the necessary home.
It is as healthy to enjoy sentiment as to enjoy jam.
Emotion is primarily about nothing and much of it remains about nothing to the end.
Our emotions are only incidents in the effort to keep day and night together.
You're in bad shape when your emotions force you into acts which you know are foolish.
We're too busy keeping our emotions in check to ever dream of infinite possibilities. And maybe that is the ultimate conspiracy.
Your emotions affect every cell in your body. Mind and body, mental and physical, are intertwined.
Emotions have no place in business, unless you do business with them.
Emotions are the fuel to really move you along - that's the only way you can create music. If you don't feel any emotions, it's not going to happen.
The degree of one's emotions varies inversely with one's knowledge of the facts.
We all have human emotions that rob our lives.
Emotion is the chief source of all becoming-conscious. There can be no transforming of darkness into light and of apathy into movement without emotion.
It is a dangerous thing to have instant access to your emotions.
When we direct our thoughts properly, we can control our emotions.
Your emotions are very unstable and should never be the foundation for direction in your life.
We cannot control what emotions or circumstances we will experience next, but we can choose how we will respond to them.
Our emotions are often beautiful, but they can also be dangerous. They represent our spontaneity, and seem to speak to us of our freedom.
Emotions can certainly be misleading: they can fool you into believing stuff that is definitely, demonstrably untrue.
The first and simplest emotion which we discover in the human mind, is curiosity.
The biggest emotion in creation is the bridge to optimism.
Nothing vivifies, and nothing kills, like the emotions.
Emotion is often what we rely upon to carry us across the unfathomable voids in our intelligence.
It's a completely useless emotion - jealousy. I don't go there.
Sometimes in life one experiences an emotion which is so strong that it is difficult to think, or to reason.
Nothing's wrong with honest emotion.
Painful emotions show you what prevents you from creating harmony, cooperation, sharing and reverence for life.
You can convey a lot of emotion with just some eyebrows and mouth movement.
An emotion is suggested and demolished in one glance by certain words.
Feelings or emotions are the universal language and are to be honored. They are the authentic expression of who you are at your deepest place.
Emotion is the surest arbiter of a poetic choice, and it is the priest of all supreme unions in the mind.
Emotions are products of our mind, and we can actually train ourselves to choose whether we banish or embrace them.
Once the last trace of emotion has been eradicated, nothing remains of thought but absolute tautology.
Emotion is always the enemy of wise statesmanship.
Emotions may win arguments, but they don't win wars.
You can almost read any emotion through someone's eyes.
I think you translate emotion better when you take your hands off.
Emotion is messy, contradictory... and true.
You don't have to work hard to bring emotions. It all just comes naturally, you're there living it.
Everyone has emotions; you just learn to use then and be comfortable with them.
To give vent now and then to his feelings, whether of pleasure or discontent, is a great ease to a man's heart.
Feelings are much like waves, we can't stop them from coming but we can choose which one to surf.
But feelings can't be ignored, no matter how unjust or ungrateful they seem.
If you keep your emotions locked in a box, then when you want to open it one day you'll find that they're gone.
The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray.
Cherish your own emotions and never undervalue them.
